content: This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "SHORTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun game! Not too difficult and the statement seems clear to me.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The hardest word for me as a kid was something like 'gypsy' where there weren't any vowels.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Puzzle is clear, not too easy nor too hard, and interesting.

For me, "a game of Hangman" has a very specific set of rules:
- a single player guesses letters of a word/phrase
- whenever an incorrect letter is guessed, a line is added to a drawing of a stick figure being hanged
- if the drawing is completed before the whole word is guessed (maybe 10 or 11 lines), the player loses

Your letter-guessing game is similar, but not the same. I'm concerned that this could cause confusion. 

After reading the statement through once, I *think* I understand the rules, but I'm not 100% sure. Having to re-read the (fairly lengthy) statement is not great for a CoC.

Edit (after solving):
- My understanding of the rules was correct (I didn't need to re-read the statement)
- There are no test cases where Alice and Bob have the same score. I'm not sure if the output should be Alice 0 (because Alice goes first) or something else. I suggest including "Alice and Bob will never take the same number of guesses to reveal the word".
- I don't believe *your* solution can be coded in 5 minutes :P

Meaning no offense, it genuinely feels like you've made a concerted effort to be confused by the problem statement. Changing the phrasing to "a game kind of like Hangman" would not be an improvement; everyone who knows the gist of Hangman should understand what's going on, and those unfamiliar won't have their judgment clouded by preconceived notions.

I would have trouble believing you if you said it took you more than a minute to read the entire thing.
